TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit NSAffineTransform extends MonoMac.Foundation.NSObject

Docs.summary: NSAffineTransform provides methods for manipulating and applying affine transforms
Docs.remarks: A transform provides instructions for transforming points from one coordinate system to another. An affine transformation preserves parallel lines.

MemberSignature.Value: public NSAffineTransform ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new identity transformation.
Docs.remarks: An identity transformation converts any point to the same point.

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class MonoMac.Foundation.NSAffineTransform transform) cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new transformation matching the input value.

Docs.summary: A constructor that initializes the object from the data stored in the unarchiver object.
Docs.remarks: This constructor is provided to allow the class to be initialized from an unarchiver (for example, during NIB deserialization).

Docs.summary: Constructor to call on derived classes when the derived class has an [Export] constructor.

remarks.para: This constructor should be called by derived classes when they are initialized using an [Export] attribute. The argument value is ignore, typically the chaining would look like this:

MemberSignature.Value: public NSAffineTransform (IntPtr handle);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int handle) cil managed

Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of unmanaged objects; Called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a pointer to an unmanaged Objective-C object. You should not invoke this method directly, instead you should call the GetNSObject method as it will prevent two instances of a managed object to point to the same native object.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void AppendTransform (MonoMac.Foundation.NSAffineTransform transform);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AppendTransform(class MonoMac.Foundation.NSAffineTransform transform) cil managed

Docs.param: A transformation to concatenate with the caller
Docs.summary: Caller's transformation is replaced with caller's transformation multiplied by the supplied transformation
Docs.remarks: This is equivalent to applying the caller's transformation, then applying the provided transformation. Compare with PrependTransform.

MemberSignature.Value: public override IntPtr ClassHandle { get; }
.property instance native int ClassHandle

Docs.summary: The handle for this class.
Docs.value: The pointer to the Objective-C class.
Docs.remarks: Each MonoMac class mirrors an unmanaged Objective-C class. This value contains the pointer to the Objective-C class, it is similar to calling objc_getClass with the object name.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Concat ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Concat() cil managed

Docs.summary: Appends the caller's transformation to the current graphics context.
Docs.remarks: The current graphics context typically has a transformation reflecting the needs of the screen, window and superviews. This method adds additional transformation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Invert ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Invert() cil managed

Docs.summary: Replaces the transformation in the caller with the inverse of its current transformation.
Docs.remarks: Applying an inverse transformations, will revert coordinates to thier previous values. This is handy when used with the concat method to undo changes to the current graphics context

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void PrependTransform (MonoMac.Foundation.NSAffineTransform transform);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void PrependTransform(class MonoMac.Foundation.NSAffineTransform transform) cil managed

Docs.param: A transformation to concatenate with this transformation
Docs.summary: This transformation is replaced by the supplied transformation multiplied by the this transformation
Docs.remarks: This is equivalent to applying the provided transformation then applying the caller's transformation. Compare with AppendTransform.

Docs.param: The scale factor for the X and Y directions.
Docs.summary: Appends the scale factor to both axis in this transformation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Scale (float scaleX, float scaleY);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Scale(float32 scaleX, float32 scaleY) cil managed

Docs.param: The scale factor for the X direction.
The scale factor for the Y direction.
Docs.summary: Appends the scale factors to this transformation.
Docs.remarks: A value of 1.0 does not change the scale in that direction.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Set ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Set() cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the transformation used by the current graphics context to this transformation.
Docs.remarks: The concat method should generally be prefered to this method. The current graphics context contains transformations for the screen, window and superviews that are lost when this method is used.

Docs.summary: Applies this transformation to size and returns the result.
Docs.returns: A new size resulting from transforming the input size.
Docs.remarks: Size represents a vector from (0,0), and is immune to translation effects of the transformation.
